content: Which French author, known for his adventure novels, created the characters Phileas Fogg and Passepartout in his book "Around the World in Eighty Days"?

The French author who created the characters Phileas Fogg and Passepartout in his book "Around the World in Eighty Days" is Jules Verne. Verne was a pioneer of the science fiction genre and is often referred to as the "Father of Science Fiction." His works, including "Twenty Thousand Leagues Under the Sea" and "Journey to the Center of the Earth," have had a profound influence on literature and popular culture.
